channel.title: Paper Rose on Nancy's Creative Mess
channel.description: Recent content in Paper Rose on Nancy's Creative Mess

item.title: *Stencilled Thanks*
item.description: I am back to work this afternoon after my week of isolation thanks to Covid. I am feeling really good except a lingering tiredness but I’m sure that will get better with time. I really need to just take planned holidays from work instead of illness and injury!! A friend asked for some thank you cards recently so I did up a few different designs for her. I really liked the look of using the last bit of ink on the blending brush to go over the white spots left behind by stencilling so I did a few like this one…

item.title: *Less is More #470*
item.description: There’s a new clean and simple challenge at Simply Less is More…. our theme for this challenge is Butterflies! I hope you’ll play along with us and share your creations HERE! The design team has some beautiful butterfly cards for you to see… be sure to go to the blog to check them out! I cut some of those gorgeous little butterflies out of glitter paper to create my card…

item.title: *CAS Colours & Sketches #477*
item.description: Patricia is our host for the month of July at CAS Colours & Sketches… she chose this wonderfully right colour palette for our first challenge this month. Being a part of this design team, I have discovered that I am much better at sketch challenges than I am with colour challenges. When I was only playing along, if the colours didn’t speak to me, I didn’t play. If the colours were at all challenging to me, I didn’t play.

item.title: *Less is More #468*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge with Less is More…. our cue word for challenge #468 is “emboss”. You can use any interpretation of the word in your clean and simple card. I decided to go with an embossing folder for my card… and I grabbed the etched butterflies from my pile of extras from the card I shared a few days ago as I think they look embossed as well.

item.title: *Time Out Challenges #217*
item.description: Time Out Challenges is back with a great new challenge… this time we want you to be inspired by being kind! Our sponsor for this challenge is CAS-ual Friday stamps. I got these wonderful new dies from Paper Rose and couldn’t wait to play with them. I love how they look cut out of the gold foil cardstock! Card Info *Cardstock: gold mirror; Stampin’ Up! Basic Black *Images: Simon Says Stamp Big Thanks Words; Stampendous Big Words Thanks

item.title: *Addicted to CAS #219*
*Less is More #462*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge with the team at Less is More. As you can see from the graphic below, the prompt is “occupations”. As always, we hope you’ll play along with our challenge and share your creations with us HERE! I struggled a bit with the challenge as I don’t really have any stamps that scream “occupations” to me… so I had to think outside the box a little.
